body_html:
The compiled TensorFlow Python extension for Python 3.5 depends on python35.dll, so I doubt Yaroslav's suggestion will work.

It should be possible to build TensorFlow for Python 3.6 manually by following the instructions here on a machine that has Python 3.6 installed. We haven't yet set up automated build and testing resources to make an official Windows/Python 3.6 distribution, but hope to do that when time permits.
body_text:
The compiled TensorFlow Python extension for Python 3.5 depends on python35.dll, so I doubt Yaroslav's suggestion will work.
It should be possible to build TensorFlow for Python 3.6 manually by following the instructions here on a machine that has Python 3.6 installed. We haven't yet set up automated build and testing resources to make an official Windows/Python 3.6 distribution, but hope to do that when time permits.
body:
The compiled TensorFlow Python extension for Python 3.5 depends on `python35.dll`, so I doubt Yaroslav's suggestion will work.

It should be possible to build TensorFlow for Python 3.6 manually by following the instructions [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/README.md) on a machine that has Python 3.6 installed. We haven't yet set up automated build and testing resources to make an official Windows/Python 3.6 distribution, but hope to do that when time permits.
